Message.MsgText: The server is unable to publish the Will message to topic {0}: Error={1} RC={2}.

Explanation.p: The server was unable to publish the Will message. The message was discarded.

OperatorResponse.p: Use the return code to help diagnose the problem cause and determine appropriate action. Contact IBM support for further assistance.

Message.MsgText: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} data recovery is in progress (recovering data generation {0}).

Explanation.p: The server must recover the previous state as it starts, which might take several minutes.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: Data recovery completed successfully.

Explanation.p: The server successfully recovered its previous state during startup.

OperatorResponse.p: None.

Message.MsgText: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} data recovery failed: Error={0} RC={1}.

Explanation.p: The server encountered a problem while attempting to recover its previous state during startup.

OperatorResponse.p: Use the return code to help diagnose the problem cause and determine appropriate action. Contact IBM Support for further assistance.

Message.MsgText: A failure has occurred at location {0}:{1}. The failure recording routine has been called.

Explanation.p: The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} server encountered a problem. The failure recording routine has been called with details of the failure.

OperatorResponse.p: Use the data provided by the failure recording routine to see whether a solution is already available. If a solution is not already available, contact IBM Support. Do not discard this data until the problem has been resolved.

Message.MsgText: An unrecoverable failure has occurred at location {0}:{1}. The failure recording routine has been called. The server will now stop and restart.

Explanation.p: The ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} server encountered a problem. The failure recording routine has been called with details of the failure.
The server will now stop and restart.

OperatorResponse.p: Use the data provided by the failure recording routine to see whether a solution is already available. If a solution is not already available, contact IBM Support. Do not discard this data until the problem has been resolved.

Message.MsgText: The limit of {1} messages buffered on queue {0} has been reached.

Explanation.p: The maximum number of messages buffered on this queue has been reached.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that rate of messages sent to this queue does not exceed the rate at which they can be consumed.

Message.MsgText: The limit of {1} messages buffered for subscription {0} has been reached.

Explanation.p: The maximum number of messages buffered for this subscription has been reached.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that rate of messages published matching this subscription does not exceed the rate at which they can be consumed.

Message.MsgText: Queue {0} was deleted because it is no longer defined in the server configuration.

Explanation.p: The queue was found during the restart of the server but it no longer appears in the server configuration. The queue has been deleted.

OperatorResponse.p: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: The server encountered a problem as it started and is unable to start messaging. Error={0} RC={1}.

Explanation.p: The server encountered a problem while attempting to recover its previous state during startup.

OperatorResponse.p: Use the return code (and any earlier log messages) to help diagnose the problem cause and determine appropriate action. One or more of the following actions may be appropriate:
i) Changing the setting Server.TolerateRecoveryInconsistencies to true will attempt to recover as much data as possible though some data loss may occur
ii) Performing a clean store operation to wipe the persistent data store
iii) Contact an IBM service representative

Message.MsgText: The limit of {1} message bytes buffered for remote server {0} has been reached.

Explanation.p: The maximum number of message bytes buffered for this remote server has been reached.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the rate of messages being published to matching subscribers on this remote server does not exceed the rate at which they can be sent.

Message.MsgText: A record with handle 0x{0} (identifier: {1} type {2} ({3})) could not be recovered for reason {4} ({5})

Explanation.p: The data in the persistent data store is inconsistent and could not be recovered. Depending on recovery settings, this will cause recovery to be aborted or the problematic records to be discarded.

OperatorResponse.p: If inconsistent data is preventing the server from starting one or more of the following actions may be appropriate:
i) Changing the setting Server.TolerateRecoveryInconsistencies to true will attempt to recover as much data as possible though some data loss may occur
ii) Performing a clean store operation to wipe the persistent data store
iii) Contact an IBM service representative

Message.MsgText: Recovery has found inconsistencies in the persistent data store and recovered however {0} items have been discarded

Explanation.p: Some data could not be read from the persistent data store however recovery was configured to continue anyway and completed.

OperatorResponse.p: If the cause of the inconsistent data is not understood then it may be appropriate to contact IBM Support for assistance. If it is preferable that in the case of inconsistencies, the server does not start (to allow further investigation) then change the Server.TolerateRecoveryInconsistencies to false

Message.MsgText: Export of resources to file {0} with request ID {1} started. ClientID={2}, Topic={3}.

Explanation.p: The request to export resources to the specified file has started. Use the request ID to determine the current status of the request.

OperatorResponse.p: None.

Message.MsgText: Export of resource type {0} with identifier {1} as part of request ID {2} failed with return code {3}.

Explanation.p: The export of the specified resource failed.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the reason for the failure and correct it.

Message.MsgText: Export of resources with request ID {0} succeeded.

Explanation.p: The request to export resources has completed successfully.

OperatorResponse.p: None.

Message.MsgText: Export of resources with request ID {0} failed with return code {1}.

Explanation.p: The request to export resources has failed. Use the request ID to identify the reason for the failure.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the reason for the failure and correct it.

Message.MsgText: Import with request ID {0} from file {1} started.

Explanation.p: The request to import resources from the specified file has started. Use the request ID to determine the current status of the request.

OperatorResponse.p: None.

Message.MsgText: Import of resource type {0} with identifier {1} as part of request ID {2} failed with return code {3}.

Explanation.p: The import of the specified resource failed.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the reason for the failure and correct it.

Message.MsgText: Import of resources with request ID {0} succeeded.

Explanation.p: The request to import resources has completed successfully.

OperatorResponse.p: None.

Message.MsgText: Import of resources with request ID {0} failed with return code {1}.

Explanation.p: The request to import resources has failed. Use the request ID to identify the reason for the failure.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the reason for the failure and correct it.

Message.MsgText: The state for clientId {0} is being forcibly discarded for reason {1} ({2}).

Explanation.p: The state being maintained on the server for the specified clientId is being discarded because the client and server are out of synchronization.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the reason for the failure and correct it.

Message.MsgText: ResourceSetID {0} is set {1} of {2} sorted by StatType {3}. Full statistics: {4}

Explanation.p: The resource set specified is one of a group being reported.

OperatorResponse.p: None.

Message.MsgText: ResourceSetID {0} has TotalMemoryBytes {1}. Full statistics: {2}

Explanation.p: The resource set specified is one of a group being reported.

OperatorResponse.p: None.

Message.MsgText: The subscription can only be updated via the {0} API.

Explanation.p: Administrative subscriptions can only be updated or deleted using the APIs specific to them, and a subscription that has not been designated an administrative subscription can not be updated or deleted using the administrative subscription APIs.

OperatorResponse.p: Perform the action using the correct API for the type of subscription being updated.

Message.MsgText: The value {1} for property {0} must match the existing value {2}.

Explanation.p: When designating an existing subscription as an administrative subscription, the properties for the operation must match those of the existing subscription.

OperatorResponse.p: Either retry the operation with subscription properties matching the existing subscription or remove the existing subscription and then retry the operation.

Message.MsgText: The operation was not performed because a warning is in place for the asynchronous callback queues.

Explanation.p: Some low-priority activities are not performed when too many operations are waiting for disk input/output to complete.

OperatorResponse.p: Retry the operation when the system is not under such heavy load.

Message.MsgText: The specified topic name is already defined as a cluster requested topic.

Explanation.p: A topic only needs to be designated as a cluster requested topic once and it has already been performed for the specified topic.

OperatorResponse.p: No further action is required.

Message.MsgText: The topic name for a cluster requested topic must contain a maximum of 32 levels.

Explanation.p: The topic filter in the request has too many levels (instances of the / character).

OperatorResponse.p: Retry the request with a topic filter that has fewer levels.
